task_summary: Detect the T-block and target outline, approach and align, set tool yaw, push the block along the required direction into the target area, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a marked target outline on a tabletop. The contact sheet shows perception, approach, alignment, a directional push, and final retreat. The behavior emphasizes reliable detection, gentle alignment before contact, and a single continuous push towards the goal. The target appears as a drawn outline on the surface. The plan assumes 10 Hz control/observation but encodes timing through conservative action timeouts. Success is defined by the block seated within the outline with the robot safely retracted.
preconditions: T-block and target outline on table
End-effector calibrated; yaw can be set
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and descend to a safe pre-contact height.
Align to the block’s push face and set yaw.
Execute a straight push towards the target.
success_criteria: Block lies inside the target outline with correct orientation
Tool retreats to a safe distance
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: rescan and retry.
If misaligned or slip occurs: re-approach and realign, then re-push.
If overshoot: re-detect, reposition, and perform a shorter corrective push.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is detected within the target region and the arm has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to localize the T-block.
Move above the block to a safe pre-contact height.
Descend/align to the push face with precise tolerance.
Orient tool yaw to align push direction.
Execute straight push toward the target area.
Retract to a safe distance after placement.

failure_modes: Unintended contact with table or robot body
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and realign with smaller tolerance
Perform corrective shorter push toward residual error
Retreat and reattempt if contact force spikes
assumptions: Instruction color mentions (gray/green/blue) do not match frames (red block, blue outline). Treated the drawn outline as the fixed target.
Camera frame assumed: 0°=+x (right), 90°=up; downward push modeled as 270°.
Single continuous push sufficient; no grasp required.

expected_success_criteria: Block’s silhouette overlaps target outline after push
Robot performs one smooth push without losing contact
Final retreat achieved without disturbing placement
